info.title: Order Management
info.description: The Walmart Order Management APIs help Sellers to manage customerâ€™s Sales Orders and to stay up-to-date on orders fulfillment, which orders to fulfill, and when to fulfill them.

post.description: You can use this API to acknowledge an entire order, including all of its order lines. The response to a successful call contains the acknowledged order.

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: purchaseOrderId

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

parameters.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
parameters.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

parameters.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
parameters.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

parameters.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
parameters.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID

parameters.name: WM_SVC.NAME
parameters.description: Walmart Service Name

purchaseOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the seller's purchase order

customerOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified customer

customerEmailId.description: The email address of the customer for the sales order

orderType.description: Specifies if the order is a regular order or replacement order. Possible values are REGULAR or REPLACEMENT. Provided in response only if query parameter replacementInfo=true.

originalCustomerOrderID.description: customer order ID of the original customer order on which the replacement is created.

orderDate.description: The date the customer submitted the sales order

buyerId.description: Unique ID associated with the specified buyer

estimatedDeliveryDate.description: The estimated time and date for the delivery of the item. Format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:MM:ssZ Example: '2020-06-15T06:00:00Z'

estimatedShipDate.description: The estimated time and date when the item will be shipped. Format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:MM:ssZ Example: '2020-06-15T06:00:00Z'

methodCode.description: The shipping method. Can be one of the following: Standard, Express, OneDay, WhiteGlove, Value or Freight

name.description: The name for the person/place of shipping address

address1.description: The first line of the shipping address

address2.description: The second line of the shipping address

city.description: The city of the shipping address

state.description: The state of the shipping address

postalCode.description: The zip code of the shipping address

country.description: The country of the shipping address

postalAddress.description: Elements of the customer's postal address

shippingInfo.description: The shipping information provided by the customer to the seller

orderLine.description: A list of order lines in the order

lineNumber.description: The line number associated with the details for each individual item in the purchase order

productName.description: The name of the product associated with the line item. Example: 'Kenmore CF1' or '2086883 Canister Secondary Filter Generic 2 Pack'

sku.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, assigned to each item in the item file

imageUrl.description: Optional. Web URL for the image of the item.

unit.description: Standard value of measurement of the item. Example: 'Pounds'

weight.description: Optional. Weight information for the item.

item.description: The information for the item on the orderLine

charge.description: Information relating to the charge for the orderLine

chargeType.description: The charge type for line items can be one of the following: PRODUCT or SHIPPING For details, refer to 'Charge Types'

chargeName.description: If chargeType is PRODUCT, chargeName is Item Price. If chargeType is SHIPPING, chargeName is Shipping

currency.description: The type of currency for the charge. Example: USD for US Dollars

amount.description: The numerical amount for that charge. Example: 9.99

chargeAmount.description: The details for the amount of the tax charge

taxName.description: The name associated with the tax. Example: 'Sales Tax'

currency.description: The type of currency for the charge. Example: USD for US Dollars

amount.description: The numerical amount for that charge. Example: 9.99

taxAmount.description: The details for the amount of the tax charge

tax.description: Tax information for the charge, including taxName and taxAmount

items.description: List of elements that make up a charge

charges.description: Information relating to the charge for the orderLine

amount.description: Always use '1'

statusDate.description: The date shown on the recent order status

orderLineStatus.description: Detail List of Order Line status

amount.description: Always use '1'

cancellationReason.description: If order is cancelled, cancellationReason will explain the reason

shipDateTime.description: The date the package was shipped

otherCarrier.description: Other carrier name, When otherCarrier is used, trackingUrl must also be provided

carrier.description: The package shipment carrier. Valid entries are: UPS, USPS, FedEx, Airborne, OnTrac, DHL, LS (LaserShip), UDS (United Delivery Service), UPSMI (UPS Mail Innovations), FDX, PILOT, ESTES, SAIA, FDS Express, Seko Worldwide, HIT Delivery, FEDEXSP (FedEx SmartPost).

methodCode.description: The shipping method. Can be one of the following: Standard, Express, OneDay, WhiteGlove, Value or Freight

trackingURL.description: The URL for tracking the shipment. This parameter is mandatory if the otherCarrier parameter is used

trackingInfo.description: List of information about the package shipment and tracking updates

name.description: The name for the person/place of return address

address1.description: The first line of the return address

address2.description: The second line of the return address

state.description: The state of the return address

postalCode.description: The zip code of the return address

country.description: The country of the return address

returnCenterAddress.description: Gives Sellers the ability to specify the RC center address during fulfillment; any returns created for the PO will always be returned to the RC address specified

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ns3:order xmlns:ns2="http://walmart.com/mp/orders" xmlns:ns3="http://walmart.com/mp/v3/orders" xmlns:ns4="com.walmart.services.common.model.money" xmlns:ns5="com.walmart.services.common.model.name" xmlns:ns6="com.walmart.services.common.model.address" xmlns:ns7="com.walmart.services.common.model.address.validation" xmlns:ns8="http://walmart.com/">
    <ns3:purchaseOrderId>1796277083022</ns3:purchaseOrderId>
    <ns3:customerOrderId>5281956426648</ns3:customerOrderId>
    <ns3:customerEmailId>3A31739D8B0A45A1B23F7F8C81C8747F@relay.walmart.com</ns3:customerEmailId>
    <ns3:orderDate>2019-09-14T13:09:31.000Z</ns3:orderDate>
    <ns3:shippingInfo>
        <ns3:phone>3155598681</ns3:phone>
        <ns3:estimatedDeliveryDate>2019-09-25T19:00:00.000Z</ns3:estimatedDeliveryDate>
        <ns3:estimatedShipDate>2019-09-17T06:00:00.000Z</ns3:estimatedShipDate>
        <ns3:methodCode>Value</ns3:methodCode>
        <ns3:postalAddress>
            <ns3:name>Kathryn Cole</ns3:name>
            <ns3:address1>3258BWarners rd</ns3:address1>
            <ns3:address2>Garage</ns3:address2>
            <ns3:city>Warners</ns3:city>
            <ns3:state>NY</ns3:state>
            <ns3:postalCode>13164</ns3:postalCode>
            <ns3:country>USA</ns3:country>
            <ns3:addressType>RESIDENTIAL</ns3:addressType>
        </ns3:postalAddress>
    </ns3:shippingInfo>
    <ns3:orderLines>
        <ns3:orderLine>
            <ns3:lineNumber>4</ns3:lineNumber>
            <ns3:item>
                <ns3:productName>Beba Bean Pee-pee Teepee Airplane - Blue - Laundry Bag</ns3:productName>
                <ns3:sku>test1</ns3:sku>
            </ns3:item>
            <ns3:charges>
                <ns3:charge>
                    <ns3:chargeType>PRODUCT</ns3:chargeType>
                    <ns3:chargeName>ItemPrice</ns3:chargeName>
                    <ns3:chargeAmount>
                        <ns3:currency>USD</ns3:currency>
                        <ns3:amount>10.00</ns3:amount>
                    </ns3:chargeAmount>
                    <ns3:tax>
                        <ns3:taxName>Tax1</ns3:taxName>
                        <ns3:taxAmount>
                            <ns3:currency>USD</ns3:currency>
                            <ns3:amount>0.80</ns3:amount>
                        </ns3:taxAmount>
                    </ns3:tax>
                </ns3:charge>
            </ns3:charges>
            <ns3:orderLineQuantity>
                <ns3:unitOfMeasurement>EACH</ns3:unitOfMeasurement>
                <ns3:amount>1</ns3:amount>
            </ns3:orderLineQuantity>
            <ns3:statusDate>2019-09-17T20:45:56.000Z</ns3:statusDate>
            <ns3:orderLineStatuses>
                <ns3:orderLineStatus>
                    <ns3:status>Acknowledged</ns3:status>
                    <ns3:statusQuantity>
                        <ns3:unitOfMeasurement>EACH</ns3:unitOfMeasurement>
                        <ns3:amount>1</ns3:amount>
                    </ns3:statusQuantity>
                </ns3:orderLineStatus>
            </ns3:orderLineStatuses>
            <ns3:fulfillment>
                <ns3:fulfillmentOption>S2H</ns3:fulfillmentOption>
                <ns3:shipMethod>VALUE</ns3:shipMethod>
                <ns3:pickUpDateTime>2019-09-19T19:00:00.000Z</ns3:pickUpDateTime>
            </ns3:fulfillment>
        </ns3:orderLine>
    </ns3:orderLines>
</ns3:order>

post.description: Refunds one or more order lines that have been shipped. The response to a successful call contains the order with the refunded line items

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: purchaseOrderId

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

parameters.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

parameters.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID

parameters.description: Walmart Service Name

application/xml.example:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<orderRefund xmlns="http://walmart.com/mp/v3/orders">
    <purchaseOrderId>2575193093772</purchaseOrderId>
    <orderLines>
        <orderLine>
            <lineNumber>1</lineNumber>
            <refunds>
                <refund>
                    <refundComments>test test</refundComments>
                    <refundCharges>
                        <refundCharge>
                            <refundReason>DamagedItem</refundReason>
                            <charge>
                                <chargeType>PRODUCT</chargeType>
                                <chargeName>Item Price</chargeName>
                                <chargeAmount>
                                    <currency>USD</currency>
                                    <amount>-10.02</amount>
                                </chargeAmount>
                                <tax>
                                    <taxName>Item Price Tax</taxName>
                                    <taxAmount>
                                        <currency>USD</currency>
                                        <amount>-5.03</amount>
                                    </taxAmount>
                                </tax>
                            </charge>
                        </refundCharge>
                        <refundCharge>
                            <refundReason>TaxExemptCustomer</refundReason>
                            <charge>
                                <chargeType>SHIPPING</chargeType>
                                <chargeName>Shipping Price</chargeName>
                                <chargeAmount>
                                    <currency>USD</currency>
                                    <amount>-1.02</amount>
                                </chargeAmount>
                                <tax>
                                    <taxName>Shipping Tax</taxName>
                                    <taxAmount>
                                        <currency>USD</currency>
                                        <amount>-0.05</amount>
                                    </taxAmount>
                                </tax>
                            </charge>
                        </refundCharge>
                    </refundCharges>
                </refund>
            </refunds>
        </orderLine>
    </orderLines>
</orderRefund>

get.description:
Retrieves all the orders with line items that are in the "created" status, that is, these orders have been released from the Walmart Order Management System to the seller for processing. The released orders are the orders that are ready for a seller to fulfill.

Only orders created in last 180 days and a maximum of 20000 orders can be fetched at a time. Attempting to download more than 20000 orders will return an error.

parameters.name: createdStartDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that were created after this date. Default is current date - 7 days. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ).

parameters.name: createdEndDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that were created before this date. Default is current date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of orders to be returned. Cannot be larger than 200.

parameters.name: productInfo
parameters.description: Provides the image URL and product weight in response, if available. Allowed values are true or false.

parameters.name: shipNodeType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of shipNode. Allowed values are SellerFulfilled(Default), WFSFulfilled and 3PLFulfilled.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: A seller-provided Product ID

parameters.name: customerOrderId
parameters.description: The customer order ID

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: The purchase order ID. One customer may have multiple purchase orders.

parameters.name: fromExpectedShipDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that have order lines with an expected ship date after this date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ)

parameters.name: toExpectedShipDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that have order lines with an expected ship date before this date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ)

parameters.name: shippingProgramType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of program. Allowed value is TWO_DAY.

parameters.name: replacementInfo
parameters.description: Provides additional attributes - originalCustomerOrderID, orderType - related to Replacement order, in response, if available. Allowed values are true or false.

parameters.name: orderType
parameters.description: Specifies if the order is a regular order or replacement order. Possible values are REGULAR or REPLACEMENT. Provided in response only if query parameter replacementInfo=true.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

parameters.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
parameters.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

parameters.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
parameters.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

parameters.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
parameters.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID

parameters.name: WM_SVC.NAME
parameters.description: Walmart Service Name

limit.description: Number of purchase orders in the current page.

nextCursor.description: String to be used as query parameter for getting next set of purchase orders, when more than 200 orders are retrieved.

post.description: Updates the status of order lines to Shipped and trigger the charge to the customer. The response to a successful call contains the order with the shipped line items.

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: purchaseOrderId

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

parameters.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
parameters.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

parameters.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
parameters.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

parameters.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
parameters.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID

parameters.name: WM_SVC.NAME
parameters.description: Walmart Service Name

processMode.description: Optional. Use this parameter only to update tracking information after order is shipped. Use 'PARTIAL_UPDATE' as value. Here PARTIAL_UPDATE will indicate that post shipment tracking information needs to be updated

orderLine.description: Information about one order line shipment

lineNumber.description: The line number associated with the details for each individual item in the purchase order

sellerOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified Seller; gives Sellers the ability to print their own custom order ID on the return label; limit of 30 characters

orderLineStatus.description: Details about the Order Line status

amount.description: Always use '1'

shipDateTime.description: The date the package was shipped

otherCarrier.description: Other carrier name, When otherCarrier is used, trackingUrl must also be provided

carrier.description: The package shipment carrier. Valid entries are: UPS, USPS, FedEx, Airborne, OnTrac, DHL, LS (LaserShip), UDS (United Delivery Service), UPSMI (UPS Mail Innovations), FDX, PILOT, ESTES, SAIA, FDS Express, Seko Worldwide, HIT Delivery, FEDEXSP (FedEx SmartPost).

methodCode.description: The shipping method. Can be one of the following: Standard, Express, OneDay, WhiteGlove, Value or Freight

trackingURL.description: The URL for tracking the shipment. This parameter is mandatory if the otherCarrier parameter is used

trackingInfo.description: List of information about the package shipment and tracking updates

name.description: The name for the person/place of return address

address1.description: The first line of the return address

address2.description: The second line of the return address

    <orderLines>

                    </trackingInfo>
                </orderLineStatus>
            </orderLineStatuses>
        </orderLine>
    </orderLines>
</order>

get.description:
Retrieves the details of all the orders for specified search criteria.

Only orders created in last 180 days and a maximum of 20000 orders can be fetched at a time. Attempting to download more than 20000 orders will return an error.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: A seller-provided Product ID

parameters.name: customerOrderId
parameters.description: The customer order ID

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: The purchase order ID. One customer may have multiple purchase orders.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Status of purchase order line. Valid statuses are: Created, Acknowledged, Shipped, Delivered and Cancelled.

parameters.name: createdStartDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that were created after this date. Default is current date - 7 days. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ).

parameters.name: createdEndDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that were created before this date. Default is current date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ).

parameters.name: fromExpectedShipDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that have order lines with an expected ship date after this date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ)

parameters.name: toExpectedShipDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that have order lines with an expected ship date before this date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ)

parameters.name: lastModifiedStartDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that were modified after this date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ).

parameters.name: lastModifiedEndDate
parameters.description: Fetches all purchase orders that were modified before this date. Use either UTC or ISO 8601 formats. Date example: '2020-03-16'(yyyy-MM-dd). Date with Timestamp example: '2020-03-16T10:30:15Z'(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of orders to be returned. Cannot be larger than 200.

parameters.name: productInfo
parameters.description: Provides the image URL and product weight in response, if available. Allowed values are true or false.

parameters.name: shipNodeType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of shipNode. Allowed values are SellerFulfilled(Default), WFSFulfilled and 3PLFulfilled.

parameters.name: shippingProgramType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of program. Allowed value is TWO_DAY.

parameters.name: replacementInfo
parameters.description: Provides additional attributes - originalCustomerOrderID, orderType - related to Replacement order, in response, if available. Allowed values are true or false.

parameters.name: orderType
parameters.description: Specifies if the order is a regular order or replacement order. Possible values are REGULAR or REPLACEMENT. Provided in response only if query parameter replacementInfo=true.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

parameters.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
parameters.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

parameters.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
parameters.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

parameters.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
parameters.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID

parameters.name: WM_SVC.NAME
parameters.description: Walmart Service Name

limit.description: Number of purchase orders in the current page.

nextCursor.description: String to be used as query parameter for getting next set of purchase orders, when more than 200 orders are retrieved.

nextCursor.description: String to be used as query parameter for getting next set of purchase orders, when more than 200 orders are retrieved.

purchaseOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the seller's purchase order

customerOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified customer

customerEmailId.description: The email address of the customer for the sales order

orderType.description: Specifies if the order is a regular order or replacement order. Possible values are REGULAR or REPLACEMENT. Provided in response only if query parameter replacementInfo=true.

originalCustomerOrderID.description: customer order ID of the original customer order on which the replacement is created.

orderDate.description: The date the customer submitted the sales order

buyerId.description: Unique ID associated with the specified buyer

estimatedDeliveryDate.description: The estimated time and date for the delivery of the item. Format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:MM:ssZ Example: '2020-06-15T06:00:00Z'

estimatedShipDate.description: The estimated time and date when the item will be shipped. Format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:MM:ssZ Example: '2020-06-15T06:00:00Z'

methodCode.description: The shipping method. Can be one of the following: Standard, Express, OneDay, WhiteGlove, Value or Freight

name.description: The name for the person/place of shipping address

address2.description: The second line of the shipping address

city.description: The city of the shipping address

state.description: The state of the shipping address

postalCode.description: The zip code of the shipping address

country.description: The country of the shipping address

postalAddress.description: Elements of the customer's postal address

shippingInfo.description: The shipping information provided by the customer to the seller

orderLine.description: A list of order lines in the order

productName.description: The name of the product associated with the line item. Example: 'Kenmore CF1' or '2086883 Canister Secondary Filter Generic 2 Pack'

sku.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, assigned to each item in the item file

imageUrl.description: Optional. Web URL for the image of the item.

unit.description: Standard value of measurement of the item. Example: 'Pounds'

weight.description: Optional. Weight information for the item.

item.description: The information for the item on the orderLine

charge.description: Information relating to the charge for the orderLine

chargeName.description: If chargeType is PRODUCT, chargeName is Item Price. If chargeType is SHIPPING, chargeName is Shipping

currency.description: The type of currency for the charge. Example: USD for US Dollars

get.description: Retrieves an order detail for a specific purchaseOrderId

parameters.name: purchaseOrderId
parameters.description: purchaseOrderId

parameters.name: productInfo
parameters.description: Provides the image URL and product weight in response, if available. Allowed values are true or false.

parameters.name: replacementInfo
parameters.description: Provides additional attributes - originalCustomerOrderID, orderType - related to Replacement order, in response, if available. Allowed values are true or false.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

parameters.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
parameters.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

parameters.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
parameters.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

parameters.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
parameters.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID

parameters.name: WM_SVC.NAME
parameters.description: Walmart Service Name

purchaseOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the seller's purchase order

customerOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified customer

customerEmailId.description: The email address of the customer for the sales order

orderDate.description: The date the customer submitted the sales order

buyerId.description: Unique ID associated with the specified buyer

estimatedDeliveryDate.description: The estimated time and date for the delivery of the item. Format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:MM:ssZ Example: '2020-06-15T06:00:00Z'

estimatedShipDate.description: The estimated time and date when the item will be shipped. Format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:MM:ssZ Example: '2020-06-15T06:00:00Z'

methodCode.description: The shipping method. Can be one of the following: Standard, Express, OneDay, WhiteGlove, Value or Freight

name.description: The name for the person/place of shipping address

address1.description: The first line of the shipping address

address2.description: The second line of the shipping address

city.description: The city of the shipping address

state.description: The state of the shipping address

postalCode.description: The zip code of the shipping address

country.description: The country of the shipping address

postalAddress.description: Elements of the customer's postal address

shippingInfo.description: The shipping information provided by the customer to the seller

orderLine.description: A list of order lines in the order

lineNumber.description: The line number associated with the details for each individual item in the purchase order

productName.description: The name of the product associated with the line item. Example: 'Kenmore CF1' or '2086883 Canister Secondary Filter Generic 2 Pack'

sku.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, assigned to each item in the item file

imageUrl.description: Optional. Web URL for the image of the item.

unit.description: Standard value of measurement of the item. Example: 'Pounds'

weight.description: Optional. Weight information for the item.

item.description: The information for the item on the orderLine

charge.description: Information relating to the charge for the orderLine

chargeType.description: The charge type for line items can be one of the following: PRODUCT or SHIPPING For details, refer to 'Charge Types'

chargeName.description: If chargeType is PRODUCT, chargeName is Item Price. If chargeType is SHIPPING, chargeName is Shipping

currency.description: The type of currency for the charge. Example: USD for US Dollars

amount.description: The numerical amount for that charge. Example: 9.99

chargeAmount.description: The details for the amount of the tax charge

taxName.description: The name associated with the tax. Example: 'Sales Tax'

currency.description: The type of currency for the charge. Example: USD for US Dollars

amount.description: The numerical amount for that charge. Example: 9.99

taxAmount.description: The details for the amount of the tax charge

items.description: List of elements that make up a charge

charges.description: Information relating to the charge for the orderLine

amount.description: Always use '1'

statusDate.description: The date shown on the recent order status

orderLineStatus.description: Detail List of Order Line status

amount.description: Always use '1'

cancellationReason.description: If order is cancelled, cancellationReason will explain the reason

shipDateTime.description: The date the package was shipped

otherCarrier.description: Other carrier name, When otherCarrier is used, trackingUrl must also be provided

carrier.description: The package shipment carrier. Valid entries are: UPS, USPS, FedEx, Airborne, OnTrac, DHL, LS (LaserShip), UDS (United Delivery Service), UPSMI (UPS Mail Innovations), FDX, PILOT, ESTES, SAIA, FDS Express, Seko Worldwide, HIT Delivery, FEDEXSP (FedEx SmartPost).

trackingURL.description: The URL for tracking the shipment. This parameter is mandatory if the otherCarrier parameter is used

trackingInfo.description: List of information about the package shipment and tracking updates

shippingProgramType.description: Gives shipping program information. Examples TWO_DAY, THREE_DAY

sellerOrderId.description: A unique ID associated with the sales order for specified Seller; gives Sellers the ability to print their own custom order ID on the return label; limit of 30 characters

items.description: Purchase Order line information for each item

orderLines.description: A list of order lines in the order

items.description: Payment Types
List of pickup persons

type.description: Specifies the type of shipNode. Allowed values are SellerFulfilled, WFSFulfilled and 3PLFulfilled.

authorization.name: Authorization
authorization.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

accessToken.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
accessToken.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

channelType.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
channelType.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

correlationId.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
correlationId.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID
